title: Who said it? Elon, Stark, or Luthor

questions.quote: Peace means having a bigger stick than the other guy.
questions.speaker: Tony Stark
questions.context: Explaining his defense philosophy in the first Iron Man film.

questions.quote: I would like to die on Mars. Just not on impact.
questions.speaker: Elon Musk
questions.context: His famous, morbid quip about SpaceX's goals.

questions.quote: Do you know the oldest lie in America? It's that power can be innocent.
questions.speaker: Lex Luthor
questions.context: Spoken to a senator in Batman v Superman.

questions.quote: There's a billion-to-one chance we're living in base reality.
questions.speaker: Elon Musk
questions.context: Discussing simulation theory at a tech conference.

questions.quote: I successfully privatized world peace.
questions.speaker: Tony Stark
questions.context: Bragging to Congress in Iron Man 2.

questions.quote: Some people can read War and Peace and come away thinking it's a simple adventure story. Others can read the ingredients on a chewing gum wrapper and unlock the secrets of the universe.
questions.speaker: Lex Luthor
questions.context: Gene Hackman's iconic line in the 1978 Superman film.

questions.quote: I am a free speech absolutist.
questions.speaker: Elon Musk
questions.context: His tweet regarding social media moderation.

questions.quote: Sometimes you gotta run before you can walk.
questions.speaker: Tony Stark
questions.context: Testing his early flight thrusters in Iron Man.

questions.quote: If man won't kill God, the Devil will do it!
questions.speaker: Lex Luthor
questions.context: Creating Doomsday in Batman v Superman.

questions.quote: I think it is possible for ordinary people to choose to be extraordinary.
questions.speaker: Elon Musk
questions.context: An inspirational quote from an interview.

questions.quote: Is it better to be feared or respected? I say, is it too much to ask for both?
questions.speaker: Tony Stark
questions.context: Presenting the Jericho missile in Iron Man.

questions.quote: Devils don't come from hell beneath us. No, they come from the sky.
questions.speaker: Lex Luthor
questions.context: Looking at a painting of angels and demons in Batman v Superman.

questions.quote: Who controls the memes, controls the Universe.
questions.speaker: Elon Musk
questions.context: A tech-bro philosophy tweeted in 2020.

questions.quote: We create our own demons.
questions.speaker: Tony Stark
questions.context: The opening narration of Iron Man 3.

questions.quote: If God is all-powerful, He cannot be all good. And if He is all good, then He cannot be all-powerful.
questions.speaker: Lex Luthor
questions.context: His theological argument against Superman in BvS.

questions.quote: I’m nauseatingly pro-human.
questions.speaker: Elon Musk
questions.context: Defending his stance on human survival and AI.

questions.quote: I told you, I don't want to join your super-secret boy band.
questions.speaker: Tony Stark
questions.context: Rejecting Nick Fury's Avengers initiative in Iron Man 2.

questions.quote: God is tribal. God takes sides.
questions.speaker: Lex Luthor
questions.context: More of his theology from Batman v Superman.

questions.quote: If I die under mysterious circumstances, it’s been nice knowin ya.
questions.speaker: Elon Musk
questions.context: A paranoid tweet posted during tensions with Russia.

questions.quote: My armor, it was never a distraction or a hobby, it was a cocoon.
questions.speaker: Tony Stark
questions.context: Explaining his PTSD coping mechanism in Iron Man 3.

questions.quote: The bittersweet pain among men is having knowledge with no power.
questions.speaker: Lex Luthor
questions.context: Complaining about politicians in Batman v Superman.

questions.quote: I am an alien.
questions.speaker: Elon Musk
questions.context: A literal, contextless tweet from 2021.

questions.quote: You're missing the point. There's no throne. There is no version of this where you come out on top.
questions.speaker: Tony Stark
questions.context: Threatening Loki in The Avengers.

questions.quote: The bell's already been rung. And they've heard it. Out in the dark. Among the stars.
questions.speaker: Lex Luthor
questions.context: His terrifying final warning in Batman v Superman.

questions.quote: My mind is a storm... I don't think most people would want to be me.
questions.speaker: Elon Musk
questions.context: Describing his brain on the Joe Rogan podcast.

questions.quote: Everything I've done, everything I'll do today, everything I'll ever do, I do to protect this world.
questions.speaker: Tony Stark
questions.context: Explaining his motivation in the MCU.

questions.quote: You're a flying god who is too stupid to see the strings.
questions.speaker: Lex Luthor
questions.context: Insulting Superman's naivety.

questions.quote: I operate on the physics approach to analysis.
questions.speaker: Elon Musk
questions.context: Describing his First Principles thinking.

questions.quote: It's not about me. It's not about you. It's about the legacy we leave behind.
questions.speaker: Tony Stark
questions.context: Discussing the future of Stark Industries.

questions.quote: To see a god bleed... what a privilege.
questions.speaker: Lex Luthor
questions.context: Enjoying the use of Kryptonite.

questions.quote: I am the glitch.
questions.speaker: Elon Musk
questions.context: A surreal joke he tweeted.

questions.quote: I know I said no more surprises, but I gotta say, I was really hoping to pull off one last one.
questions.speaker: Tony Stark
questions.context: Recording his final message in Avengers: Endgame.

questions.quote: I am the greatest criminal mind of our time!
questions.speaker: Lex Luthor
questions.context: Gene Hackman's classic boast in 1978's Superman.

questions.quote: Just stop lying about sh*t. Just stop lying.
questions.speaker: Elon Musk
questions.context: Tweeting angrily at media or critics.

questions.quote: Following's not really my style.
questions.speaker: Tony Stark
questions.context: Dismissing Captain America's orders in The Avengers.

questions.quote: Mankind must be allowed to achieve its own destiny, free from the interference of alien overlords.
questions.speaker: Lex Luthor
questions.context: His core comic book motivation against aliens.

questions.quote: Some people don't like change, but you need to embrace change if the alternative is disaster.
questions.speaker: Elon Musk
questions.context: A 2014 quote about his relentless push for disruption.

questions.quote: I don't like people handing me things.
questions.speaker: Tony Stark
questions.context: His famous, quirky pet peeve from the MCU.

questions.quote: Mind over muscle.
questions.speaker: Lex Luthor
questions.context: His classic mantra proving brain beats brawn.

questions.quote: I keep forgetting that you're still alive.
questions.speaker: Elon Musk
questions.context: Infamously tweeted to Senator Bernie Sanders.

questions.quote: I see a suit of armor around the world.
questions.speaker: Tony Stark
questions.context: His paranoid pitch for the Ultron program.

questions.quote: No matter how much you try to save the world, it always manages to find a new way to destroy itself.
questions.speaker: Lex Luthor
questions.context: A classic comic book justification for his villainy.

questions.quote: To our knowledge, we are the only life that exists.
questions.speaker: Elon Musk
questions.context: Discussing the Fermi paradox.

questions.quote: They say that the best weapon is the one you never have to fire.
questions.speaker: Tony Stark
questions.context: Presenting weapons in Iron Man.

questions.quote: It's not about power. It's about the intellect. Power is just a side effect.
questions.speaker: Lex Luthor
questions.context: A philosophical comic book quote.

questions.quote: If you need inspiring words, don't do it.
questions.speaker: Elon Musk
questions.context: His blunt, anti-motivational advice.

questions.quote: I prefer the weapon you only have to fire once.
questions.speaker: Tony Stark
questions.context: Presenting the Jericho missile.

questions.quote: I've spent my whole life proving that human ingenuity can overcome any obstacle, even a god.
questions.speaker: Lex Luthor
questions.context: His eternal struggle against the Man of Steel.

questions.quote: I could either watch it happen or be a part of it.
questions.speaker: Elon Musk
questions.context: Explaining why he got involved in aerospace.

questions.quote: You know, it's moments like these when I realize what a superhero I am.
questions.speaker: Tony Stark
questions.context: Being sarcastic while saving people in Iron Man 3.

questions.quote: People don't want to think. They want to be told what to think.
questions.speaker: Lex Luthor
questions.context: His cynical view of the general public.

questions.quote: When something is important enough, you do it even if the odds are not in your favor.
questions.speaker: Elon Musk
questions.context: Justifying his risky business ventures.

questions.quote: I'm just not the hero type. Clearly.
questions.speaker: Tony Stark
questions.context: Downplaying his own virtue in Iron Man.

questions.quote: We don't have to rely on aliens to save us. We can save ourselves.
questions.speaker: Lex Luthor
questions.context: The core of his xenophobic ideology.

questions.quote: My biggest mistake is probably weighing too much on someone's talent and not someone's personality.
questions.speaker: Elon Musk
questions.context: Reflecting on his hiring practices.

questions.quote: Sometimes the best we can do is to start over.
questions.speaker: Tony Stark
questions.context: Before destroying his suits in Iron Man 3.

questions.quote: Everything you do is a muscle reflex. My brain is my muscle.
questions.speaker: Lex Luthor
questions.context: Explaining his superiority in the comics.

questions.quote: I think most people can learn a lot more than they think they can.
questions.speaker: Elon Musk
questions.context: His philosophy on human potential.

questions.quote: I'm sorry, Earth is closed today. You better pack it up and get out of here.
questions.speaker: Tony Stark
questions.context: Insulting Ebony Maw in Avengers: Infinity War.

questions.quote: What are we without our intellect? We're just animals.
questions.speaker: Lex Luthor
questions.context: A philosophical justification for his ego.

questions.quote: Patience is a virtue, and I'm learning patience. It's a tough lesson.
questions.speaker: Elon Musk
questions.context: Admitting a flaw during a difficult production period.

questions.quote: I have a plan: Attack.
questions.speaker: Tony Stark
questions.context: His highly tactical suggestion in The Avengers.

questions.quote: Boys! We're not here to fight. We're here to conquer.
questions.speaker: Lex Luthor
questions.context: Kevin Spacey's line in Superman Returns.

questions.quote: I don't spend my time pontificating about high-concept things; I spend my time solving engineering and manufacturing problems.
questions.speaker: Elon Musk
questions.context: Defending his hands-on approach to factory floors.

questions.quote: I am a futurist.
questions.speaker: Tony Stark
questions.context: A classic descriptor of himself from Marvel Comics.

questions.quote: I don't want to destroy the world. I want to save it from itself.
questions.speaker: Lex Luthor
questions.context: His ultimate, twisted rationalization.

questions.quote: Starting a business is like eating glass and staring into the abyss.
questions.speaker: Elon Musk
questions.context: His dark analogy for entrepreneurship.

questions.quote: If we can't protect the Earth, you can be damn well sure we'll avenge it.
questions.speaker: Tony Stark
questions.context: Threatening Loki in The Avengers.

questions.quote: I’m not trying to be anyone’s savior. I’m just trying to think about the future and not be sad.
questions.speaker: Elon Musk
questions.context: A rare moment of grounded humility.

questions.quote: I was born with an intellect that is a curse as much as it is a gift.
questions.speaker: Lex Luthor
questions.context: A comic book quote about the burden of genius.
